metadata.title: USN-7229-1 -- ClamAV vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled decrypting OLE2 content. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7229-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  clamav - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamav-base - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamav-daemon - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamav-doc - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamav-docs - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamav-freshclam - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamav-milter - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamav-testfiles - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 clamdscan - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 libclamav-dev - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 libclamav12 - 1.4.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.24.10.1 No subscription required
